name: flute
definition: A high pitched woodwind instrument consisting of a slender tube closed at one end with keys and finger holes on the side and a mouthpiece near the closed end.
description:
The flute is a family of musical instruments in the woodwind group. Unlike woodwind instruments with reeds, a flute is an reedless.

Although flute is one of the woodwind instruments, it is made of metal. Anyway, it was made of wood a long time ago.

The flute produces its sound from the flow of air across an lateral opening. It doesn't need lip vibration like brass instruments.

Player can change the pitch by pushing buttons or changing the direction of the breath. These buttons are called keys. The breath also can change the tone or the volume.

The flute sounds very bright and cheerful playing high notes. It can also sound very thoughtful or sad when playing in its lowest register.

A person who plays a flute is called a flautist.

Orchestras have at least 2 flutes each, sometimes three or four. Sometimes there is 1 piccolo which plays an octave higher, or an alto flute which plays a fifth lower than the flute.

facts.name: Not really so hard to play
facts.value: While flutes may look intimidating with all of their keys and holes, you can easily start learning how to play.

facts.name: Large repertoire of music for the flute
facts.value: There is a large repertoire of music for the flute. Baroque composers used them in their orchestras, usually in pairs, and composed concertos, chamber music and solo music for them.

facts.name: Sounds produced by air vibration
facts.value: Flute players hold it flat, and make a sound by blowing their breath over the edge of the hole of flute's head. It sounds thanks to the vibration of air.

facts.name: Modern flute created by Boehm
facts.value: On the middle of XIX-th century, a Bavarian flute maker named Boehm reformed past flute largely to enlarge the volume and improve the way of using the chromatic scale.

facts.name: Flute is 67 cm long
facts.value: Flute is 67 cm long, with a bore of about 2 cm, built in three sections.

facts.name: The sound of flute is high
facts.value: The sound of flute is high, so composers often express it as a bird. And a flute matches with many instrument like violin and piano.

facts.name: Flute has ancient ancestors
facts.value: Flutes are the earliest extant musical instruments. A number of flutes dating to about 43,000 to 35,000 years ago have been found in the Swabian Jura region of present-day Germany.

facts.name: Needs the second most amount of air
facts.value: Although looks like a delicate instrument, flute needs the second most amount of air for an instrument, next to the tuba.

facts.name: Made of metal
facts.value: There are many kinds of flute, so the material also varies. Most flutes are made of silver but gold and platinum are also used.

related.definition: The piccolo is a half-size flute, and a member of the woodwind family of musical instruments.
The bass flute is the tenor member of the flute family. It is in the key of C, pitched one octave below the concert flute.
The bansuri is a transverse flute from a single hollow shaft of bamboo with six or seven finger holes.
A wooden Japanese  end-blown flute with four holes in front and one at the back.
A simple wind instrument consisting of a series of pipes or reeds of graduated length bound together, played by blowing across the top open ends.
The pungi is a wind instrument played by snake charmers in India and Pakistan.
